Key Arguments: The bill is seen as misguided, un-Australian, and foreign with no upsides.
Concerns about who will authorize electoral or referendum content, fearing it could lead to abuse of power and dictatorship.
The scope of ACMA powers is too broad, potentially affecting freedom of speech across various digital platforms.
The bill's categorization of 'harm' could infringe on religious freedom and expression, potentially labeling religious texts as hate speech.
Notable Quotes: Silencing people at any kind of election or referendum can only lead to an abuse of power and a dictatorship, a truly terrifying thought.
What kind of place will Australia become with such overreach into peoples personal lives, I shudder to think.
I can only then see this bill as antisemitic and discriminatory.
